intro: Meibomia viridis, commonly known as the green meibomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are usually glossy green. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. Meibomia viridis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
